Birds fly through a combination of wing shape, muscle power, and physics. Their wings are curved on top and flatter below, creating lift as air moves faster over the top surface. Strong flight muscles power the wing beats, while hollow bones keep them lightweight. Tail feathers provide steering and stability, and specialized respiratory systems supply the oxygen needed for sustained flight.
